alert.note: Alert for Curry; Quay; San Miguel (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 24 at 5:38PM MDT until May 24 at 6:15PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM MDT FOR EASTERN SAN MIGUEL...SOUTHEASTERN QUAY AND NORTHEASTERN CURRY COUNTIES... At 538 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 12 miles northeast of Quay, or 13 miles southeast of Tucumcari, moving south at 20 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Tucumcari, San Jon, Grady, Glenrio, Broadview, Wheatland, Bellview and Bard. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 331 and 373. State Road 104 between Mile Markers 101 and 105. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Accumulations of hail on roads can create very slick and hazardous driving conditions.
